==4.x Ice Cream Sandwich==
==4.x Ice Cream Sandwich==
â
[[File:Galaxy Nexus.png|220px|thumb|right|[[Galaxy Nexus]] introduced Android 4.0 "Ice Cream Sandwich"]]
+
[[File:Galaxy Nexus.png|300px|thumb|right|[[Galaxy Nexus]] introduced Android 4.0 "Ice Cream Sandwich"]]
Ice Cream Sandwich was previewed at the May 2011 [[Google I/O]] event,<ref name="i/o 2011 stats">{{cite web |url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/05/android-momentum-mobile-and-more-at.html |title=Android: momentum, mobile and more at Google I/O |first= Hugo |last=Barra |work=The Official Google Blog |date=10 May 2011|accessdate=10 May 2011}}</ref> and officially launched at the [[Galaxy Nexus]] and Ice Cream Sandwich release event on 19 October 2011.<ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RX4btquQzUE</ref>
Ice Cream Sandwich was previewed at the May 2011 [[Google I/O]] event,<ref name="i/o 2011 stats">{{cite web |url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2011/05/android-momentum-mobile-and-more-at.html |title=Android: momentum, mobile and more at Google I/O |first= Hugo |last=Barra |work=The Official Google Blog |date=10 May 2011|accessdate=10 May 2011}}</ref> and officially launched at the [[Galaxy Nexus]] and Ice Cream Sandwich release event on 19 October 2011.<ref>http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RX4btquQzUE</ref>
The SDK for Android 4.0 was publicly released on 19 October 2011.<ref>19 October 2011, [http://socialbarrel.com/android-4-0-ice-cream-sandwich-sdk-now-available/24093/ Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich SDK Now Available], Social Barrel</ref> Gabe Cohen from Google said that it is "theoretically compatible" with any Android 2.3.x device currently in production.<ref>19 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-confirms-nexus-s-will-get-ice-cream-sandwich-for-real/ Google confirms Nexus S will get Ice Cream Sandwich -- for real this time (Gingerbread devices, too)], Engadget</ref> The source code for this version is scheduled to be released after the Galaxy Nexus ships.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.zdnetasia.com/android-4-0-to-be-open-source-in-coming-weeks-62302580.htm |title=Android 4.0 to be open source in 'coming weeks' |author=Aloysius Low|work=ZDNet|date=20 October 2011|accessdate=21 October 2011}}</ref>
The SDK for Android 4.0 was publicly released on 19 October 2011.<ref>19 October 2011, [http://socialbarrel.com/android-4-0-ice-cream-sandwich-sdk-now-available/24093/ Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich SDK Now Available], Social Barrel</ref> Gabe Cohen from Google said that it is "theoretically compatible" with any Android 2.3.x device currently in production.<ref>19 October 2011, [http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-confirms-nexus-s-will-get-ice-cream-sandwich-for-real/ Google confirms Nexus S will get Ice Cream Sandwich -- for real this time (Gingerbread devices, too)], Engadget</ref> The source code for this version is scheduled to be released after the Galaxy Nexus ships.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.zdnetasia.com/android-4-0-to-be-open-source-in-coming-weeks-62302580.htm |title=Android 4.0 to be open source in 'coming weeks' |author=Aloysius Low|work=ZDNet|date=20 October 2011|accessdate=21 October 2011}}</ref>
